channel.title: Good Documentary?
channel.description:
Been browsing hulu plus and netflix for something to watch, and found allot of stuff on meth, cocain, and one about herbal incense on crime inc which sucked monkey balls. My question is... is there any good documentary on either of these sites not related to drugs and also 100% entertaining?
The first answer wins an award :|

item.title: Good Documentary?
item.dc:creator: @MooningPanda MooningPanda
item.description:
@MooningPanda wrote:

[quote=“jme, post:5, topic:517757”]A new one from National Geographic called Chasing Ice was pretty nice, Id suggest watching in HD. It’s just another movie documenting melting glaciers. A lot of scenes were amazing to watch.

Older now, but Wonders of the Universe by bbc, is an absolute must. Episode 2 (star dust) is my favorite. History channel also has a lot of great space series, I forget what they are called but it’s on youtube. Pretty much anything by BBC Horizon is awesome too.

But the most entertaining docs Ive ever watched have come from Vice.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X4koXeZvAfg[/youtube]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZRuSS0iiFyo[/youtube]

If you have monthly internet limits, be careful with vice. They are so addicting you will rack up your bill without noticing >.>[/quote]
no worries, i have a t1 line at my office and a very nice paycheck to look forward to at the end of the payweek ;D
Vice got me hooked on DMT for a little while ;D thennnn i freaked out and lost a 3rd finger in a knife incident. I thought i was chopping vegetables that could talk.

Read full topic

item.title: Good Documentary?
item.dc:creator: @jme jme
item.description:
@jme wrote:

A new one from National Geographic called Chasing Ice was pretty nice, Id suggest watching in HD. It’s just another movie documenting melting glaciers. A lot of scenes were amazing to watch.

Older now, but Wonders of the Universe by bbc, is an absolute must. Episode 2 (star dust) is my favorite. History channel also has a lot of great space series, I forget what they are called but it’s on youtube. Pretty much anything by BBC Horizon is awesome too.

But the most entertaining docs Ive ever watched have come from Vice.
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X4koXeZvAfg[/youtube]
[youtube]http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ZRuSS0iiFyo[/youtube]

If you have monthly internet limits, be careful with vice. They are so addicting you will rack up your bill without noticing >.>

Read full topic
